header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 41/2019 (Rajendra Jadhav etc.1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000245-2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Tukaram Dhondiba Kamble suspecting applicants' involvement in the offence of pun/u/Sec. 408 of Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

arguments.text: 3) Advocate for applicants contended that, the accusation against the applicants is totally false, the applicants have no concern with the alleged offence, applicant no. 1, 2 are the employee of the Said Credit Society and applicant no.3 is retired employee of the same, all the documents regarding shares of the members were in custody of Managing Committee and applicants have no concerned with the same, they are innocent, applicants have strong apprehension of arrest, hence they prayed for ad­interim pre­arrest bail in the matter.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Advocate for applicants contended that, the accusation against the applicants is totally false, the applicants have no concern with the alleged offence, applicant no. 1, 2 are the employee of the Said Credit Society and applicant no.3 is retired employee of the same, all the documents regarding shares of the members were in custody of Managing Committee and applicants have no concerned with the same, they are innocent, applicants have strong apprehension of arrest, hence they prayed for ad­interim pre­arrest bail in the matter.

arguments.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicants are innocent and assured that, they will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if they are released on interim­anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, applicants having no connection with this alleged offence and they are falsely involved in this crime.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicants are innocent and assured that, they will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if they are released on interim­anticipatory bail.
It is also argued that, applicants having no connection with this alleged offence and they are falsely involved in this crime.

arguments.text: 5) It appears that, FIR is disclosing the names of the applicants and one another, however, it is not disclosing in what capacity, the accused­applicants had misappropriated the amount. On the contrary, it seems that, informant was aware about the information given by the concerned society that, payment was made to him since 2007. It also seems that, he has moved for the claim of amount and lastly after 10 years of having knowledge of the facts he lodged FIR.

argumentSentences.text: 5) It appears that, FIR is disclosing the names of the applicants and one another, however, it is not disclosing in what capacity, the accused­applicants had misappropriated the amount.
On the contrary, it seems that, informant was aware about the information given by the concerned society that, payment was made to him since 2007.
It also seems that, he has moved for the claim of amount and lastly after 10 years of having knowledge of the facts he lodged FIR.

arguments.text: 6) Facts will be disclosed by the prosecution after filing say, hence, till filing say by prosecution, application may be allowed.

argumentSentences.text: 6) Facts will be disclosed by the prosecution after filing say, hence, till filing say by prosecution, application may be allowed.

order.text: ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is allowed. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant no.1 Rajendra Bapu Jadhav, applicant no.2 Sanjay Shivling Todkar and applicant no.3 Pradeep Shankar Chorge they be released on interim pre­arrest bail, in respect of the complaint filed by Tukaram Dhondiba Kamble in C.R.No. 53 of 2019 on their furnishing personal bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Fiuve Thousand), each with one or more surety/ies, till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicants shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicants shall make available themselves and co­ operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicants shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicants shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicants shall not be confirmed.

footer: Notice r/o. 25.01.2019. (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 21st January, 2019 Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 41/2019 (Rajendra Jadhav etc.1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000245-2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Tukaram Dhondiba Kamble suspecting applicants' involvement in the offence of pun/u/Sec. 408 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4. 
---argument-ends---
3) Advocate for applicants contended that, the accusation against the applicants is totally false, the applicants have no concern with the alleged offence, applicant no. 1, 2 are the employee of the Said Credit Society and applicant no.3 is retired employee of the same, all the documents regarding shares of the members were in custody of Managing Committee and applicants have no concerned with the same, they are innocent, applicants have strong apprehension of arrest, hence they prayed for ad­interim pre­arrest bail in the matter. 
---argument-ends---
4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicants are innocent and assured that, they will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if they are released on interim­anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, applicants having no connection with this alleged offence and they are falsely involved in this crime. 
---argument-ends---
5) It appears that, FIR is disclosing the names of the applicants and one another, however, it is not disclosing in what capacity, the accused­applicants had misappropriated the amount. On the contrary, it seems that, informant was aware about the information given by the concerned society that, payment was made to him since 2007. It also seems that, he has moved for the claim of amount and lastly after 10 years of having knowledge of the facts he lodged FIR. 
---argument-ends---
6) Facts will be disclosed by the prosecution after filing say, hence, till filing say by prosecution, application may be allowed. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is allowed. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant no.1 Rajendra Bapu Jadhav, applicant no.2 Sanjay Shivling Todkar and applicant no.3 Pradeep Shankar Chorge they be released on interim pre­arrest bail, in respect of the complaint filed by Tukaram Dhondiba Kamble in C.R.No. 53 of 2019 on their furnishing personal bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Fiuve Thousand), each with one or more surety/ies, till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicants shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicants shall make available themselves and co­ operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicants shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicants shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicants shall not be confirmed. 
---order-ends---
Notice r/o. 25.01.2019. (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 21st January, 2019 Satara
